book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [1] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Sa'id narrated 'Whoever sells a slave and he has wealth' from Qatadah from Ikrimah from Ibn Umar. And Hisham and Hammam narrated it from Ikrimah - and he is Ibn Khalid - from Al-Zuhri.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [2] I said to Ahmad: Sa'id bin Abi Arubah from Ayyub from Nafi' from Ibn Umar, who said: 'We used to wipe (over socks/shoes) while we were with our Prophet.' He said: I ask Allah for well-being.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: So I said: Shu'aib bin Ishaq? He said: Shu'aib heard it from him at his last breath. Al-Husayn said: Meaning that Shu'aib bin Ishaq heard this hadith from Sa'id bin Abi Arubah at his last breath. [3] I said to Ahmad: It is narrated from the hadith of [Al-Zuhri] from Uthman regarding Ila' (oath of abstention from wife)...

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: ...as a divorce. He rejected it. So Al-Zuhri said: He only narrates from Abu Bakr, Sa'id, [and Qabisah], who is Ibn Dhu'ayb. And people narrate from Ata al-Khurasani from...

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: ...Sa'id. And the opinion of Sa'id bin al-Musayyib is contrary to that which is narrated. [4] He said: I heard Ahmad mention the hadith of Ibn Abbas regarding the eclipse prayer, that Abd al-Rahman said such and such rak'ahs in it. And Waki' used to differ with him. So it was presented to him - meaning to Waki' - after that, and he retracted it and adopted what Abd al-Rahman said. [5] He said: I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal being asked about the hadith of Maimun bin Abi Shabib from Mu'adh or from Abu Dharr that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said to him: 'Fear Allah.' He said: Waki' used to narrate it from Mu'adh, then he made it from Abu Dharr. Then Ahmad mentioned hadiths of Waki' which he retracted.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: So he said: There is something in them that Al-Rabi' used to say, then he made it from Ibn al-Hanafiyyah.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [6] Ahmad narrated to us: Sufyan narrated to us: Yahya - who is Ibn Sa'id al-Ansari - narrated to us in the year twenty-four. With us was a man from the people of Yamamah called Ibrahim bin Tarif. Ibrahim said: Humaid bin Ya'qub informed me - and he is alive in Medina - he said: I heard Sa'id - who is Ibn al-Musayyib - saying: I heard a word from Umar that no one remaining heard other than me. I heard him when he saw the Kaaba saying: 'O Allah, You are Peace, and from You is peace; greet us, our Lord, with peace.' Sufyan said: So I came to Medina, and they said: He is sick and does not go out.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [7] Ahmad narrated to us: Al-Hakam narrated to us: Shu'aib - who is Ibn Abi Hamzah - narrated to us from Al-Zuhri, who said: Fatimah al-Khuza'iyyah narrated to me, and she had met most of the Companions of the Prophet (peace be upon him). [8] I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal mention Salih bin Hayyan, and he said: Zuhair made a mistake in his name and said Wasil bin Hayyan. [9] He said: I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal say: Malik narrated from Abd al-Aziz bin Qarir al-Basri; he errs in his name and says Abd al-Malik bin Qarir.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [10] He said: I heard Ahmad mention Muhammad bin Rashid, and he said: He came to Sana'a, he and Ja'far bin Sulayman, and wrote from them. [11] Then he said: I said to Ahmad: Hafs - meaning Ibn Ghiyath - did not hear from Ash'ath bin Abd al-Malik? He said: Yes, nor from Ash'ath bin Sawar, and perhaps he did not clarify.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [12] He said: And I heard Ahmad say: Isma'il bin Ulayyah did not narrate anything from him - meaning from Ash'ath bin Abd al-Malik. Hushaym heard something from him.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: - Chapter on History - [13] [Sulayman said: I said to Ahmad: Al-Zubairi claimed that Al-Nu'man bin Bashir was eight years old when [the Prophet (peace be upon him)] died. He rejected it and said: Al-Nu'man narrates things from the Prophet that he memorized.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [14] He said: And I heard [Ahmad say: Awf al-A'rabi was] older than Qatadah by two years.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [15] He said: And I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal say: [Sulayman al-Yashkuri died] in the tribulation of Ibn al-Zubair. I said to Ahmad: Was he from the people of Mecca? He said: He used to reside in Mecca. [1 b] [16] He said: I heard Ahmad mention this meaning, that Ibn Ulayyah's death was in the year ninety-three. [17] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Hisham bin Yusuf died in the year ninety-seven. [18] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Sharik was much older than Zuhair. [19] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Al-Thawri was ten years older than Ibn Uyaynah. [20] He said: And I heard Ahmad say: Al-Hasan bin Muslim bin Yanaq died before...

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: ...Tawus. And his father, Muslim bin Yanaq, remained until Shu'bah heard from him. [21] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Nafi' died in the year seventeen. [22] And I heard Ahmad say: Qatadah died seven years after Al-Hasan. [23] He said: And I heard Ahmad say: Ibn Jurayj died in the year fifty, and they claimed before people arrived in Mecca. [24] I heard Ahmad being asked: Did Waki' hear from Al-Awza'i? He said: Yes, and from Thawr - meaning Ibn Yazid. He said: Thawr performed Hajj in the year fifty. [25] I heard Ahmad say: Sufyan - meaning Al-Thawri - left Kufa in the year fifty-four and did not return.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [26] I heard Ahmad say: Ibn al-Mubarak said in the year seventy-nine: Whoever heard from Ibn Lahi'ah twenty years ago, then his hearing is sound. I heard him say: The books of Ibn Lahi'ah were burnt, they claimed, in the year sixty-four. [27] I heard Ahmad say: Hushaym died in the year eighty-three. [28] I heard him say: Abu Isma'il al-Mu'addib is old; he heard from Atiyyah al-Awfi.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: - Chapter on Names - [29 a] Sulayman said: I said to Ahmad: Isma'il bin Muslim, how many are they? He said: Three. [29 b] Isma'il bin Muslim al-Abdi, narrated from Abu al-Mutawakkil al-Naji, a Basran. I said: Is he trustworthy? He said: There is no harm in him. [29 c] He said: And Isma'il bin Muslim al-Basri who narrated from Al-Hasan and Al-Zuhri, his hadith is very objectionable (Munkar al-Hadith). The people of Basra abandoned his hadith. [Yahya] did not...

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: ...narrate from him, except that he was studying fiqh. And he is called Al-Makki; he used to live in Mecca. [29 d] And Isma'il al-Makki, who narrated from Mujahid and Ata, there is no harm in him. [30] I heard Ahmad say: Sa'id bin Mina and Sulayman bin Mina were from the people of Mecca. I think they are brothers. [31] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Abu Hazim, the companion of Sahl bin Sa'd, is Salamah bin Dinar al-Madani. [32] I said: Abu Sakhr from Abu Hazim? He said: He is Al-Madani.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [33] I said: Ajlan, from whom Ibn Abi Dhi'b narrated? He said: This is Ajlan, the client of Al-Mushma'ill. [34] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Abu Ibn Ajlan narrated from Bukayr. [35] He said: I heard Ahmad say: I heard Waki' say: Abdullah bin Ja'far Abu Ali is a client of the tribe (Hayy). He said: He was not Medinan; they moved to Medina and were attributed to it. [36] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Thabit bin Iyad is Al-A'raj from whom Malik narrated.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [37] I heard Ahmad say: Musa bin Dihqan, I only consider him Medinan. [38] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Al-Majishun is Ya'qub, and they are all attributed to him, Abd al-Aziz and Yusuf. [39] I heard Ahmad say: Sufyan - meaning Ibn Uyaynah - said: Al-Farafisah is the son-in-law of Uthman; he married his daughter. [And he is different from] Al-Farafisah bin Umair al-Hanafi. [40] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Abd al-Rahman bin Yazid...

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: ...[is from the tribe of] Asim. He is the one from whom Abd al-Rahman and Mujammi' the sons of Yazid narrate. [41] He says: He is Amr bin Shu'aib bin Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Amr. [2 a] I said: He says 'from his father' - meaning Shu'aib - from his grandfather Abdullah bin Amr. And Shu'aib heard from Abdullah bin Amr. [42] He said: I heard Ahmad say: I saw in the book of Al-Ashja'i from Sufyan from Ya'la bin Ata from Waki' bin Hudus, agreeing with Hammad bin...

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: ...Salamah. [43] I said to Ahmad: Abu al-Matawwis, who is he? He said: They claimed he is Abdullah bin al-Matawwis; some genealogists said it. [44] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Shabak was blind. [45] And I heard Ahmad say: Amr bin Murrah was blind. [46] He said: And I heard Ahmad say: Bayan bin Bishr is Abu Bishr. [47] He said: And I heard Ahmad say: Abd al-Malik bin Abi Sulayman al-Arzami was Fazari, they say. [48] He said: And I heard Ahmad name Ibn Sabit, so he said: Rawh narrated to us: Ibn Jurayj narrated to us, saying: Abd al-Rahman bin Abdullah bin Abd al-Rahman bin Sabit educated me.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [49] He said: And I heard Ahmad say: Muhammad bin Ubaidullah al-Arzami was Fazari and he settled in Arzam. [50] He said: And I heard Ahmad say: They differ, saying the client of Abi al-Lahm, and Abi al-Lahm means Umair. [51] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Ash'ath al-Humrani is the client of Humran. [52] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Sufyan from Adam, client of Khalid, from Nafi'. He said: He is Abu Yahya bin Adam. [53] He said: I said to Ahmad: Abdullah bin Ata, Sufyan narrated from him from Abu Ja'far? He said: This is the companion of the hadith of Uqbah bin Amir. Abu Dawud said: He is Salih (good/acceptable) - meaning Abdullah bin Ata.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [54] I said: Abu Laila? He said: His name is Abdullah bin Maysarah. Hushaym used to say Abu Ishaq al-Kufi. I said: He is Abu Laila. He said: These are his hadiths. [55] And I heard Ahmad another time say: Hushaym used to narrate from Abu Ishaq al-Kufi. We thought him to be Abu Laila. So Abd al-Rahman said: I confronted him with a hadith from his narrations and said: 'Did you hear it from Ikrimah?' He said: 'Yes.' Ahmad said: And when did Abu Laila hear from Ikrimah? He only narrates from Abu Hariz and Ibrahim bin Abi Hurrah. [56] He said: I heard Ahmad say: The name of Abu Hariz, the judge of Sijistan, is Abdullah bin Husayn. [57] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Abu Kudainah Yahya bin al-Muhallab narrated to us.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [58] I said to Ahmad: Abu Kabran? He said: Al-Hasan bin Uqbah. [59] It was said to him: Sufyan from Abu Yunus? He said: He is Salim bin Abi Hafsah, and he sometimes refers to him by his kunya. [60] He said: And I heard Ahmad say: Abu Hamzah who narrates from Abu Abd al-Rahman al-Sulami. He said: His name is Sa'd bin Ubaidah. [61] Abu Dawud narrated to us: Ahmad narrated to us, saying: I heard Yahya bin Adam say: Al-Sa'ib bin Malik from whom Abu Ishaq narrated the eclipse prayer is not the father of Ata bin al-Sa'ib.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [62] I said to Ahmad: Abu Manin, whom Ya'la narrated from? He said: They say he is Yazid ibn Kaysan. [63] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Dalham bin Salih is Kufan. Waki' used to say in the hadith of Ibn Buraydah 'Hajara', then he said 'Hujayr'. [64] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Khalaf bin Hawshab is Kufan. [65] He said: [Ahmad] was asked: Is Hilal bin Khabbab the brother of Yunus bin Khabbab? He said: No. [66] He said: I said to Ahmad: Abu Miskin, is his name Hurr? He said: They said...

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: ...Ibn Miskin. Abu Dawud said: And his name is Hurr. [67] He said: [I said to Ahmad]: Abu Ya'fur, the companion of Ibn Abi Awfa? He said: Waqdan. [68] I said to Ahmad: Abu [Ya'fur narrates the hadith]: When the Prophet, may Allah bless him [and grant him peace], entered the ten [days]... He said: Abdur-Rahman bin Ubayd [bin Nistas]. [69] I said to Ahmad: Uthman bin Abi Zur'ah? He said: He is Uthman Al-A'sha [2b], and Uthman bin Al-Mughirah, and Uthman Al-Thaqafi; he is called Abu Al-Mughirah.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [70] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Abu Aqil, the companion of [Abu] Al-Nadr, is Abdullah bin Aqil, meaning Al-Thaqafi. And he said: The companion of the hadith 'The mutilated one (Al-Ajda') is a devil'. [71] I heard Ahmad say: Antarah, Abu Harun bin Antarah, he is Abu Waki', [that is] his kunyah. [72] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Abu Salih Abu Suhayl is Abu Salih, the Mawla (client) of Ghatafan, and he is Abu Salih Al-Samman, and he is Abu Salih Al-Zayyat. He was one of the trustworthy ones. The Kufans heard from him; he used to come to them. [73] He said: I heard Ahmad say: And Isma'il narrates from Abu Salih...

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: ...Mahan. And he narrates from Abu Salih Badham. And they said Badhan, the Mawla of Umm Hani, meaning the author of the Tafsir. [74] He said: I said to Ahmad: Abu Abd al-Jalil bin Farrukh, Hushaym narrated from him? He said: We do not know who he is. Hushaym once said 'Farrukh', except that what we heard from him was 'Farrukh'. And he used to narrate from Abu Muhammad Al-Qurashi; it is not known who he is. [75] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Abdur-Rahman bin Ishaq, meaning the companion of Al-Nu'man, is called Abu Shaybah Al-Wasiti.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [76] I said to Ahmad: Abdullah bin Ism? He said: Isra'il says Abdullah ibn Ismah, and they say he is Ibn Ism, as Sharik said. [77] I heard Ahmad say: Musa bin Ubaydah, he said: Abu Abd al-Aziz Al-Rabadhi. [78] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Abu Hazim, whom Yazid bin Kaysan narrated from, is the companion of Mansur and Al-A'mash. [79] He said: I said to Ahmad: Amir bin Mas'ud Al-Qurashi, does he have companionship (Suhbah)? He said: I do not know; he has narrated from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. He said: And I heard Abu Dawud say: I heard Mus'ab Al-Zubayri say: He has companionship...

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: ...meaning Amir bin Mas'ud. And Ibn Al-Zubayr appointed him over the war in Kufa, and Abdullah bin Yazid Al-Khatmi was over the prayer. He said: And Al-Khatmi does not have companionship; he was young when the Prophet, may Allah bless him [and grant him peace], died. [80] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Al-Qasim bin Mukhaymirah is Kufan, he resided in Sham. [81] I heard Ahmad say: Abd al-Aziz bin Rufay', he used to be called Al-Makki (the Meccan), but he was in Kufa. [82] He said: I said to Ahmad: Jabir from Khaythamah? He said: This is Khaythamah bin Abi Khaythamah.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [83] He said: I heard Ahmad mention Abu Ishaq Al-Fazari, so he said: Marwan was his cousin; they were both from the descendants of Asma' bin Kharijah. [84] I said to Ahmad: Where was Marwan from, I mean Al-Fazari? He said: He was from the people of Kufa, he ended up in Mecca, then ended up in Damascus. [85] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Amir bin Shaqiq, Sufyan narrated from him, he is Asadi. He said: I heard Ahmad say: Waki' narrated to us from Sufyan from Amir bin Shaqiq Al-Asadi. [86] He said: I heard Ahmad say: [Humayd bin] Abdur-Rahman Al-Ru'asi is Abu Awf.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [87] He said: And I saw Ahmad name Abu Al-Mughirah [Al-Himsi], so he said: Abd al-Quddus bin Al-Hajjaj Al-Khawlani. [88] I heard Ahmad mention the Kunyah of [Al-Mughirah, so he said]: Waki' narrated to us, Al-Mughirah bin Ziyad Abu Hashim narrated to us. [3a] Al-Husayn said: I heard Abu Abd Allah Muhammad bin Abd Allah bin Ammar Al-Mawsili say: The people of Iraq err regarding the Kunyah of Al-Mughirah bin Ziyad; they say Abu Hashim, but he is Abu Hisham. He said: And his house is right here with us. I heard Ahmad say: Sufyan narrated from Abu Hashim Al-Mughirah bin Ziyad. [89] He said: I heard Ahmad mention the Kunyah of Hammad bin Abi Sulayman, so he said: Abu Isma'il. He said: He mentioned it from Abu Mu'awiyah from Malik, meaning Ibn Mighwal.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [90] And I heard Ahmad mention the Kunyah of Al-Hasan bin Ayyub Al-Hadrami as Abu Abd Allah; he mentioned it from Isam bin Khalid. [91] I said to Ahmad: Al-Hurr bin Sayyah, where is he from? He said: From Kufa. [92] I heard Ahmad say: Salim Al-Aftas is Ibn Ajlan. [93] I heard Ahmad say: Abu Khalid Al-Wasiti is Al-Dalani. [94] I heard Ahmad say: Ata, whom Ibn Awn narrated from, is Ata Al-Bazzaz, Abu Yazid bin Ata, the Mawla of Abu Awanah from above. He was from Wasit, Yazid bin Ata.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [95] I heard Ahmad say: Fadl bin Dalham, Yazid bin Harun said: He was a butcher with us in Wasit. [96] I heard Ahmad say: Bukayr bin Ma'ruf is the Qadi (Judge) of Nishapur. [97] I heard Ahmad say: Waki' used to make a mistake, saying: Abu Makin bin Aban, the brother of Al-Hakam bin Aban, meaning Nuh bin Rabi'ah. [98] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Mu'tamar was a slaver (Nakhas). [99] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Bakr bin Isa Al-Rasibi narrated to us. [100] I heard Ahmad say: Yusuf bin Ya'qub is Abu Salamah, meaning Ibn Al-Majishun.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [101] He said: I heard Ahmad name Abu Qatadah Al-Harrani, so he said: Abdullah bin Waqid. [102] I heard Ahmad [say]: Waki' narrated to us, Muhammad bin Sharik Abu Uthman Al-Makki narrated to us. [103] I heard Ahmad mention the Kunyah of Ishaq bin Isa as Abu Hashim. [104] I heard Ahmad mention the lineage of Khalid bin Ar'arah, whom Simak narrated from: Waki' narrated to us from Isra'il from Simak from Khalid bin Ar'arah. [105] I heard Ibn Hanbal mention Ibn Atiq. He said: It was read to Sufyan: His name is Sulayman bin Atiq. Sufyan said: A man from the people of Mecca. [106] I heard Ahmad say: Khalid Al-Hadhdha' (the shoemaker), his Kunyah is Abu Al-Manazil.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [107] I heard Ahmad say: Amir Al-Ahwal is Ibn Abd al-Wahid. [108] I heard Ahmad say: Hafs bin Ubaydullah, whom Ibn Ishaq and Yahya bin Abi Kathir narrated from, is not the one whom Khalaf bin Khalifah narrates from. The one whom Khalaf narrates from, I do not know anyone who narrated from him other than him. [109] I said to Ahmad: Umm Muhammad, whom Ali bin Zayd narrated from? He said: I think this is his paternal aunt. [110] He said: I heard Ahmad, it was said to him: Abu Nadrah? He said: Al-Mundhir bin Qit'ah. [111] I heard Ahmad say: Abd al-Karim Abu Umayyah used to be in Mecca.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [112] I heard Ahmad say: Ubaydullah [bin] Al-Akhnas is called Abu Malik. Ibn Abi Arubah narrated from him, calling him by the Kunyah Abu Malik, from Ata. [113] I [heard] Ahmad say: He got lost on the road to Mecca, so he was named Mu'awiyah Al-Dall (the lost one). He is trustworthy, meaning Mu'awiyah [bin Abd al-Kar]im. [114] I heard Ahmad say: Abu Qilabah is Basran. [115] Al-Husayn informed us, Abu Dawud narrated to us, Musa [bin Isma'il] bin Dinar narrated to us, he said: Ayyub said: If [Al-Fadl] Al-Raqashi had been born mute, it would have been better for him. [116] [I heard Ahmad say]: Abu Al-Khalil is Salih bin Abi Maryam. [3b] [117] And I heard him say: Al-Fadl bin Isa Al-Raqashi narrated from Ibn Uyaynah...

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: ...he is the nephew of Yazid Al-Raqashi. [118] And I heard Ahmad say: Ghalib Al-Qattan is Ibn Khattaf. [119] I heard Ahmad say: Muhammad bin Abi Al-Waddah, [Ibn] Mahdi narrates from him, he is called Abu Sa'id Al-Mu'addib. [120] And I heard Ahmad say: Abu Al-Awwam Al-Qattan is Ibn Dawar. The Sheikh said: Abu Al-Awwam is Ibn Dawud. [121] And I heard Ahmad say: Muhammad bin Abi Qays is Ibn Sa'id, and he is the one whom I think Bakr bin Khunays called by the Kunyah Abu Abdur-Rahman Al-Shami.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [122] I heard Ahmad say: Abu Habib is Al-Harith bin Mikhmar. [123] I heard Ahmad, it was said to him: Abd al-Wahid bin Qays, where is this one from? He said: From the people of Sham. [124] I heard Ahmad say: Al-Muqri used not to say 'Ali bin Rabah', he used to say 'Ali'. They claimed that he used to dislike that. [125] I said to Ahmad: Mu'awiyah bin Salih is from the people of Homs? He said: Yes...

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: ...he left Homs a long time ago. Ibn Ayyash did not hear from him. Abu Fadalah heard from him, and Abu Fadalah is old. He ended up in Al-Andalus (Spain), meaning Mu'awiyah, and was appointed as a judge over it. Then he performed Hajj, and women from Quraysh performed Hajj with him, so they heard from him in Mecca. I heard Ahmad say: Abdur-Rahman bin Mahdi said: While we were in Mecca remembering [knowledge], suddenly one came and sat with us for a little while, then started discussing with us, saying 'Narrated to us'. We said: 'Who are you?' He said: 'I am Mu'awiyah bin Salih'. So we gathered around him, and the people gathered. Ahmad said: I think his hair was not grey. [126] I said to Ahmad: Ayyub bin Tamim? He said: A Sheikh from the people of Egypt, Al-Muqri narrated from him. [127] I heard Ahmad say: Abu Tamim Al-Jayshani is Abdullah bin Malik. [128] I said to Ahmad: The name of Abu Al-Atuf? He said: Jarrah bin Minhal.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [129] I said to Ahmad: So-and-so claimed that Al-Hasan bin Imran, whom Shu'bah narrated from, is Abu Abd Allah Al-Asqalani. He said: We do not know. Rawh, he is Ibn Ubadah Al-Basri, claimed that Al-Hasan bin Imran is a Sheikh who was in Wasit. Ahmad said: Perhaps he is one of the Levantines who come to them. [130] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Ibn Shawdhab is Balkhi (from Balkh), he ended up in Basra and became educated there, then went out to Bayt al-Maqdis (Jerusalem). [131] He said: Ahmad traced the lineage for us from Ya'qub, and he is Ibn Ibrahim bin Sa'd, from his father, from Ibn Ishaq: Husayn bin Abdullah. He said: Ibn Ubaydullah bin Abbas, the one who narrated from Ikrimah. [132] I said to Ahmad: The hadith of Sufyan 'He breathes into the vessel', I mean the hadith of Sufyan from Abd al-Karim from Ikrimah from Ibn Abbas. I said: He is Al-Jazari...

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: ...I mean Abd al-Karim, he is Abu Umayyah. He said: Al-Jazari. I said: Did Al-Jazari narrate anything from Al-Hasan? He said: No. [133] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Mahbub bin Al-Hasan bin Hilal bin Abi Zaynab, meaning Al-Basri. [134] I heard Ahmad, and Uthman bin Abi Shaybah, and Al-Hasan bin Ali—and this is his wording—all of them mention it from Affan from Yahya bin Sa'id, he said: I asked Sufyan Al-Thawri, Sufyan bin Uyaynah, Malik bin Anas, and Shu'bah bin Al-Hajjaj about a man who makes mistakes in Hadith or lies in it. They said: Make his matter clear, make his matter clear.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [135] I said to Ahmad: Is it written from the Qadari (one who believes in free will against destiny)? He said: If he is not a caller [to it]. [136] I heard Ahmad say: Tolerate the Murji'ah in Hadith. [137] I said to Ahmad: If Yahya or Abdur-Rahman bin Mahdi narrates from an unknown man, is his hadith used as proof? He said: [His hadith is used as proof].

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [138] I heard Ahmad being asked about a man known for Tadlis (obfuscating sources), is he used as proof in what he did not [say 'I heard' in]? [4a] He said: I do not know. I said: Al-A'mash, when are the wordings caught for him? He said: This is narrow, meaning that you use him as proof. [139] I said to Ahmad: If Al-Firyabi and Waki' differ, is it not judged in favor of Waki'? He said: Like what? I said: What no one else narrated. He said: I do not know, Waki' is perhaps...

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: ...contradicted as well. [140] He said: I heard Ahmad say: I have not seen a people with black heads [Arabs/Iraqis] in this matter like the people of Basra, meaning Hadith and wordings, as if they learned it from Shu'bah. [141] I heard Ahmad say: The people of Kufa, their hadith has no light; they mention the reports (Akhbar).

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [142] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Abd al-Rahman bin Mahdi said: I said to Ibn al-Mubarak: 'The people of Kufa do not discern [Hadith].' He said: 'How so?' Then I met him after that, and he said to me: 'I found the matter as you said.' Ahmad said: They used to ask him about the opinion of Hammad and Al-Zuhri, and the Hadiths of the lesser [scholars].

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: - Chapter Mentioning the Trustworthy Medinans and Others - [143] Al-Husayn informed us: Sulayman narrated to us: He said: I heard Ahmad say: Umar bin Nafi', the client of Ibn Umar, was among the trustworthy ones. [144] I said to Ahmad: Is Sumayy dearer to you or Al-Qa'qa'? He said: Sumayy. I said to Ahmad: Sumayy? He said: Bakh! (Excellent!) Trustworthy.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: I said: Is Sumayy dearer to you or Suhail? He said: Sumayy. [145] I heard Ahmad say: Whatever Sa'd bin Ibrahim cares, Malik does not narrate from him. He said: I heard Ahmad [say]: I do not know what was Malik's issue with him that he did not narrate from him. Then he said: They claimed that Sa'd had admonished Malik - meaning regarding his lineage boasting - so he abandoned him. [146] I heard Ahmad mention the Hadith of 'shabbiness' (al-badhadha), and he said: Zuhair - meaning Ibn...

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: ...Muhammad - narrated it from a trustworthy person from Salih bin Kaysan - meaning by 'the trustworthy person' Salih bin Kaysan. [147] I heard Ahmad mention Abd al-Rahman bin al-Qasim, and he said: There is no one in the world like Abd al-Rahman bin al-Qasim.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [148] He said: I heard Ahmad say: It reached me from Mutarrif, who said: Malik said: Ibn Hurmuz said to me: 'Do not carry people on this opinion, for I and Rabi'ah were the first to speak about it.' [149] I said to Ahmad: Ajlan, the client of Al-Mushma'ill? He said: I see no harm in him. [150] I said to Ahmad: How is the Hadith of Ibn Ajlan? I mean Muhammad bin Ajlan. He said: There is no harm in him. [151] I heard Ahmad say: Ikrimah bin Khalid is trustworthy; Hammad bin Salamah heard hadiths from him.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [152] I heard Ahmad say: Ali bin Zaid, Ja'far bin Muhammad, Asim bin Ubaidullah, and Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Aqil - how close they are to being equal! We follow them. [153] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Ibn Uyaynah said: Some of the Sheikhs used to avoid the Hadith of Asim bin Ubaidullah. And Ahmad mentioned him but did not mention 'some'. Then he said: I looked in the book, and it has 'some'. [154] I said to Ahmad: Umar bin Abi Salamah? Salih said: It was said to Ahmad: Is he...

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: ...dearer to you or Muhammad bin Amr? He said: He is dearer to me. And they claimed that Yahya used to prefer Muhammad bin Amr over him. [155] I heard Ahmad say: They claimed that Yahya used to say: [Muhammad] bin Amr is dearer to me than Suhail. So it was said to Ahmad while I was listening: Isn't Suhail dearer to you than him? [He said: Yes]. [156] I heard Ahmad say: Dawud bin Qais is trustworthy, and he is above Hisham bin Sa'd.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [157] I said to Ahmad: [Abdullah bin A]mir bin Rabi'ah? He said: Trustworthy. [158] I heard Ahmad say: They claimed that Sa'd bin Ibrahim said [to Ibn Shihab: Who is Abu] al-Ahwas? He said: Did you not see the Sheikh who was in the mosque? It was said to Ahmad: [Is he Abu] al-Ahwas who narrated from Abu Dharr? He said: Yes. [159] I said to Ahmad: Salih, the client of Al-Taw'amah? He said: They claimed that Malik met him after he became old. [4 b] I said to Ahmad: Is his Hadith acceptable (Muqarib)? He said: As for me...

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: ...I tolerate him and narrate from him; but as for standing in a position of authority (Hujjah), then no. [160] He said: I heard Ahmad being asked about Shu'bah, the client of Ibn Abbas. He said: Malik said: He did not resemble the Qurra' (scholars/readers). And I saw Ahmad seeming to approve of his affair and not rejecting him. [161] I heard Ahmad being asked: Did anyone other than Ibn Abi Dhi'b narrate from Sa'id bin Sam'an? He said: I do not know him. [162] I said to Ahmad: Aflah bin Sa'id? He said: He is Quba'i; there is no harm in him.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [163] I said to Ahmad: Abu Zaid al-Madani? He said: What is asked about a man from whom Ayyub narrated? [164] I heard Ahmad say: Sulayman bin Bilal was the scribe of Yahya bin Sa'id, and he is Al-Ansari. [165] I heard Ahmad say: Abdullah bin Ja'far, from the offspring of Al-Miswar bin Makhramah, is called Al-Makhrami; trustworthy. And I heard Ahmad mention him another time, saying: He was sharp-minded, intelligent, a Hafiz, but Malik criticized him for being with so-and-so - Ahmad named him.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [166] I said to Ahmad: Abd al-Rahman bin Ata, from whom Ibn Abi Dhi'b narrates? He said: I see no harm in his Hadith. [167] I heard Ahmad say: Sa'd bin Ishaq is a trustworthy Sheikh. [168] I heard Ahmad say: Safwan bin Sulaym was among the best worshippers of Allah. [169] I said to Ahmad: Is Abd Rabbih bin Sa'id dearer to you or Yahya? He said: There is nothing in both of them except trustworthiness, except that Yahya is more famous.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [170] I said to Ahmad: Dawud bin Farahij? He said: Medinan. Waki' said: Shu'bah mentioned him one day and began saying... Ahmad meant that he weakened him. [171] I heard Ahmad say: Ja'far bin Najih, the grandfather of Ali, has been narrated from; there is no harm in him. [172] I heard Ahmad: Ya'qub narrated to us: My father narrated to us from Ibn Ishaq, who said: Muhammad bin Ibrahim informed me from Umar bin al-Hakam bin Thawban, and he was trustworthy. [173] I heard Ahmad say: Abd al-Khaliq bin Salamah is a trustworthy Sheikh; Shu'bah narrated from him, declaring him trustworthy more than once.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [174] I said to Ahmad: The companions of Nafi'? He said: The most knowledgeable of people regarding Nafi' is Ubaidullah, and the most prolific narrator. I said: Then after him Malik? He said: Ayyub is older. I said: Do you put Ayyub ahead of Malik? He said: Yes. [175] I heard Ahmad say: Abdullah bin Sa'id bin Abi Hind, how excellent his Hadith is and how authentic! [176] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Fatimah bint al-Mundhir, the wife of Hisham bin Urwah, regarding whom Hisham said to Muhammad bin Ishaq...

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: ...'From where used he to enter upon my wife?' [177] I heard Ahmad mention Muhammad bin Ishaq, and he said: He was a man who desired Hadith, so he would take people's books and put them in his books. I heard Ahmad being told: Ibn Ishaq narrated: Nafi' narrated to us from Ibn Umar that he took Zakat from the Christian slave? He said: This is worse for Ibn Ishaq. [178] I heard Ahmad say: Abd al-Rahman bin Ishaq al-Madani came to...

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: ...Basra, and he is above this one - meaning above Abd al-Rahman bin Ishaq al-Kufi - and he mentioned him, except that he is also not that strong. I said: The one who narrated from Abu al-Zinad? He said: It is this one - meaning Al-Madani. [179] I heard Ahmad being told: Salih bin Muhammad bin Za'idah? He said: He is Abu Waqid; he has many Hadiths. [180] I heard Ahmad being told: Ibn Abi Dhubab? He said: There is no harm in him. Al-Husayn said: He is Abd al-Rahman bin al-Harith bin Abi Dhubab. [181] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Muhammad bin Abi Yahya, there is no harm in him.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [182] And I said to Ahmad: Sa'd - meaning Ibn Sa'id? He said: He is not like those - meaning his brothers Yahya and Abd Rabbih. Sa'd is not precise in Hadith. [183] I heard Ahmad say: Mujammi' bin Yahya - meaning Al-Ansari - is a trustworthy Sheikh. [184] I said to Ahmad: Abu al-Aswad Muhammad bin Abd al-Rahman bin Nawfal, how is his Hadith? He said: [Good]. [185] I heard Ahmad say: Abd al-Rahman bin Abdullah bin Dinar, there is no harm in him, acceptable [in Hadith]. [186] I said to Ahmad: His father - meaning Ja'far [sic]? [He meant] the father of Abd al-Hamid bin Ja'far. [5 a]

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [187] I heard Ahmad being told: Al-Ala' bin Abd al-Rahman, isn't he trustworthy? He said: Yes, he is trustworthy. [188] I said to Ahmad: Umar bin Muhammad al-Asqalani? He said: Trustworthy; Sufyan narrated from him, and Abu Asim and our companions heard from him. [189] I heard Ahmad say: Abd al-Hakim bin Abi Farwah is a trustworthy Sheikh. [190] I heard Ahmad say: Asim bin Muhammad, who narrates from Muhammad bin Ka'b, is trustworthy. [191] I said to Ahmad regarding Usama bin Zaid al-Laythi? He said: He abandoned him at the end.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: And I heard Ahmad say: Yahya abandoned Usama at the end. That is because Uthman bin Umar discussed with him his narration from Ata from Jabir: 'I shaved before I threw (pebbles).' [192] I heard Ahmad say: Ibn Abi Dhi'b was trustworthy and truthful, better than...

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: ...Malik bin Anas, except that Malik was stricter in scrutinizing men than him. Ibn Abi Dhi'b did not care from whom he narrated. I heard Ahmad say: Ibn Abi Dhi'b was a Faqih (jurist). I heard Ahmad mention from Hammad al-Khayyat saying: Ibn Abi Dhi'b used to resemble Sa'id bin al-Musayyib. It was said to Ahmad: Did he leave anyone like him in his land? He said: No, nor in other than his land - meaning Ibn Abi Dhi'b. I heard Ahmad say: Malik, how correct his Hadith is from everyone! I said to Ahmad: The differences in the Hadiths of Al-Zuhri? He said: Among them are what he narrated from...

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: ...two men, and among them is what came from his companions - meaning the error. [193] I heard Ahmad mention Abd al-Hamid bin Ja'far, and he said: There is no harm in him; people have tolerated him. I heard Ahmad say: Yahya said: Sufyan al-Thawri used to weaken the Hadith of Abd al-Hamid bin Ja'far. [194] I heard Ahmad say: Yahya would not narrate from Hisham bin Sa'd. [195] I said to Ahmad: Yusuf bin al-Majishun? He said: There was no harm in him. [196] I said to Ahmad: Abd al-Hamid bin Sulayman? He said: He is the brother of Fulaih.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: He said: Yes. I said to Ahmad: Isn't Fulaih older than him? He said: Yes, by much. I said to Ahmad: How is the Hadith of Abd al-Hamid—meaning Ibn Sulayman? He said: I don't know, except that I don't think there was any harm in him. He was blind and used to live in the city of Abu Ja'far. [197] I heard Ahmad when Abd al-Aziz bin Abi Hazim was mentioned to him. He said: I hope there is no harm in him. It was said to Ahmad: Is he dearer to you or Al-Darawardi? He said: No, rather he is dearer to me, but Al-Darawardi is more knowledgeable than him. Then Ahmad said: It is said he has another issue as well—meaning Ibn Abi Hazim—he did not have many Hadiths. But when Sulayman bin Bilal died, he bequeathed [his books] to him, so his books were given to him, and he brought out many Hadiths to the people. [198] I heard Ahmad mention Al-Darawardi, and he said: His book is more correct than his memory.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: I heard Ahmad more than once say: Most of Al-Darawardi's Hadiths from Ubaidullah are the Hadiths of Abdullah al-Umari, inverted. And sometimes he would not mention 'inverted' nor 'most'. I also heard him say: Abd al-Aziz [Al-Darawar]di has objectionable Hadiths (Manakir) from Ubaidullah. [199] I heard Ahmad being told that Shu'bah said: I arrived in [Medina before the death of] Nafi', and Malik had a circle. He denied it. A twenty-one-year-old? Whatever! [I heard] Ahmad say: Malik is more knowledgeable about the people of his land. As for other than the people of his land...

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: ...he has narrated [from Abd al-Karim] Abi Umayyah, Humaid al-A'raj, and Humaid al-Tawil. It was said: Did he tolerate them due to the small number of people among them? He said: Yes. [5 b] [200] I heard Ahmad being asked about Malik's saying: 'I met the people of knowledge in our land.' He said: Rabi'ah and Ibn Hurmuz. Then Ahmad mentioned something. [201] I said to Ahmad: Was any Hadith other than this one narrated for Ibn Akimah? He said: It is narrated from a son of his. [202] I heard Ahmad say: Waki' used to refrain from the Hadith of Ibrahim bin Sa'd, then...

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: ...he narrated from him later. I said: Why? He said: I don't know; Ibrahim is trustworthy. I heard Ahmad say: Ibrahim bin Sa'd is authentic in Hadith from Ibn Ishaq. [203] I said to Ahmad: Abu Uways? He said: There is no harm in him—or he said: Trustworthy. He had come here, so they wrote from him. They claimed that the hearing of Abu Uways and the hearing of Malik were one thing. [204] I heard Ahmad say: Sahbal, the brother of Ibrahim bin Abi Yahya, is trustworthy—or he said: There is no harm in him.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [205] I heard Ahmad say: His father—meaning Abu al-Zanbari—was the closest of people to Malik. Abu Dawud said: Al-Zanbari is abandoned in Hadith, this is his father. [206] Al-Husayn said: Ibrahim bin Abi Yahya is a Qadari, abandoned in Hadith. [207] I said to Ahmad: Abd al-Rahman bin Zaid bin Aslam? He said: His brother Abdullah is trustworthy. Al-Husayn said: Abd al-Rahman bin Zaid bin Aslam is weak. He said: And I heard Ahmad another time say: Abdullah bin Zaid is reliable (Thabt).

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: Ahmad was asked: Is Abdullah bin Zaid dearer to you or Usama bin Zaid? He said: There is none among them more established than Abdullah. [208] He said: I heard Ahmad narrating a Hadith from Yusuf bin Abd al-Aziz al-Majishun, and he praised him well and said: This is not Yusuf bin Ya'qub the elder. [209] I heard Ahmad mention the saying of Al-Zuhri: 'Sa'd spoke to me regarding his son, and Sa'd is Sa'd.' He said: He meant Ibrahim bin Sa'd. [210] He said: I heard Ahmad say: Ibn Abi Fudayk does not care what he narrates. [211] I heard Ahmad say: Abdullah bin Nafi' al-Sa'igh was not good at Hadith; he was a man of Malik's opinion (Ra'y).

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [212] I heard Ahmad being asked by a man about a Hadith of Sa'id. He said: Yahya from Sa'id is more correct than Qatadah from Sa'id. What can be done with Qatadah?

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: - Chapter Mentioning the Trustworthy People of Mecca - [213] Al-Husayn narrated to us: Sulayman narrated to us: He said: I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal say: Ibn Uyaynah said: I witnessed Abu al-Zubair having a scroll read to him. I said to Ahmad: Are these the Hadiths—meaning the scroll of Sulayman, who is Al-Yashkuri—that are in people's hands from him? He said: Yes. I said: Did Abu al-Zubair take them from the scroll? He said: Abu al-Zubair used to memorize—I doubt 'memorize', how Ahmad said it—they said: Perhaps he doubted something so he looked into it.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: I heard Ahmad being asked: Did Shu'bah abandon Abu al-Zubair for this reason? He said: No, he had another story with him. [214] I heard Ahmad say: There is no one more established regarding Ata than Amr bin Dinar, then Ibn Jurayj. I heard Ahmad say: Yahya or Abd al-Rahman said—and I did not hear it from them—he said: Shu'bah said: I have not seen anyone more established than Amr bin Dinar, nor Al-Hakam and Qatadah. [215] I heard Ahmad mention from Sufyan, he said: Humaid was the most knowledgeable of the people of Mecca in inheritance laws (Fara'id) and calculation, and he had recited to Mujahid, and there was no one in Mecca more well-versed in recitation than him and Abdullah bin Kathir. I said to Ahmad: Humaid bin Qais, the brother of Umar, is he trustworthy? He said: He is righteous (Salih), and he is Humaid al-A'raj, the reciter of the people of Mecca.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [216] I heard Ahmad, when Amr bin Shu'aib was mentioned to him, say: The scholars of Hadith, if they wish, use him as proof, and if they [wish, they abandon him]. [217] I said to Ahmad: Qais bin Sa'd? He said: Trustworthy, but they claimed that the book of Hammad bin Sa[lamah was lost, so he began] narrating Hadiths from him, making them... [6 A] Ahmad mentioned: Yahya said: If what Hammad bin Salamah narrates from Qais bin Sa'd is true... He said: He spoke words implying disapproval of Hammad.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [218] I heard Ahmad say: I do not know anyone who abandoned the Hadith of Amr bin Shu'aib from his father from his grandfather. I said to Ahmad: Is the Hadith of Amr bin Shu'aib used as proof if it is from other than his father? He said: I don't know. [219] I asked Ahmad about Qais bin Sa'd, is he more prolific than Abd al-Malik al-Arzami? He said: He is more prolific than Al-Arzami; Al-Arzami has narrated from him. [220] I heard Ahmad say: If Ibn Jurayj says 'He informed me' in everything, then it is authentic.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: I heard Ahmad say: Sufyan attributed (Musnad) from Amr bin Dinar, while Ibn Jurayj has his opinion. I heard Ahmad say: The most established people regarding Amr bin Dinar are Ibn Uyaynah, then Ibn Jurayj. It was said: Hammad bin Zaid? He said: What does Hammad have? He has one hundred and fifty Hadiths or maybe not. I heard Ahmad say: Abd al-Razzaq said: I have not seen anyone with better prayer than Ibn Jurayj. I heard Ahmad say: Ibn Jurayj came to Abu Ja'far when he was in debt, and he said: I have collected the Hadith of Ibn Abbas like no one else has collected. But he did not give him anything. [221] I heard Ahmad narrating from Rabah bin Abi Ma'ruf. [222] I said to Ahmad: Ayyub bin Musa? He said: There is no harm in him, except that...

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: ...Isma'il bin Umayyah is greater than him in Hadith, and there was kinship between them. Ayyub's concern was writing contracts and studying jurisprudence. [223] I said to Ahmad: Sa'id bin Mina? He said: Trustworthy; Ayyub and more than one narrated from him. [224] I heard Ahmad being asked about Kathir bin Kathir. He said: Bakh! (Excellent!) Trustworthy. [225] I heard Ahmad being asked about Hakim bin Hakim. He said: I know nothing but good. [226] I said to Ahmad: Sadaqah bin Yasar? He said: Trustworthy; he was from the people of Al-Jazirah then settled in Hijaz. [227] I heard Ahmad being asked about Isma'il bin Kathir. He said: Meccan, called Abu Hashim, a trustworthy Sheikh. [228] I heard Ahmad [say]: There was no harm in Zuhair bin Muhammad.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [229] I heard Ahmad being asked about Ibrahim bin Nafi'. He said: Trustworthy. And Shibl is trustworthy, and Al-Jarashi is trustworthy—companions of Ibn Najih—but their opinion was Qadar (free will). [230] I heard Ahmad say: Saif bin Sulayman, they differed; some said Ibn Abi Sulayman. He is trustworthy from the people of Mecca. [231] I heard Ahmad say: Waki' used to say: Hanzalah—meaning Ibn Abi Sufyan—narrated to us; Ibn al-Mubarak heard from him, and he was trustworthy. Ahmad said: And so he was. [232] I said to Ahmad: Sa'id bin Abd al-Rahman al-Jumahi? He said: There is no...

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: ...harm in him; his Hadith is acceptable (Muqarib). [233] I heard Ahmad say: Al-Harith bin Umair, one of the companions of Ayyub, is trustworthy, trustworthy. Isma'il narrated to us from him, and Ibn Uyaynah narrates from him. [234] I heard Ahmad say: Hamzah—meaning the son of Al-Harith bin Umair—I saw him; he was a man in whom the traces of righteousness were recognized. [235] I heard Ahmad mention the Hadith of Awsajah from Ibn Abbas regarding inheritance. He said: I do not know Awsajah.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [236] He said: I mentioned to Ahmad the Hadith of Zanfal al-Arafi, the Hadith of Aisha from Abu Bakr regarding Istikhara. He recognized the Hadith. I said: Do you know him—meaning Zanfal? He said: No. [237] I heard Ahmad being asked about Abd al-Majid bin Abd al-Aziz. He said: He was knowledgeable [about Ibn] Jurayj and did not care from whom he narrated, and he has standing among the people of Mecca. It was said to Ahmad: Is he a place for narration (i.e., reliable)? [He said]: I don't know. He said: And I heard Ahmad narrate from him. [238] I heard Ahmad say: Yahya bin Sulaym is disturbed (Mudtarib) [in Hadith...

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: ...he narrated] from Ubaidullah objectionable Hadiths (Manakir). [239] I said to Ahmad: Abdullah bin al-Walid al-Adani? He said: He did not distinguish between Ibn al-Qasim and Al-Mas'udi, but the beginnings of his Hadiths were authentic. I wrote from him a good amount. [6 b] And I heard Ahmad narrate from him. [240] I said to Ahmad: From whom should I write in Mecca? He said: Abu Bishr, the son-in-law of...

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: ...Al-Muqri', and Al-Shafi'i—meaning Ibrahim. Husain [praised] him well, but I do not know him. [241] I heard Ahmad being asked about Al-Muthanna bin al-Sabbah. He said: He was from the people of Yemen, from the descendants of the Persians, and settled in Mecca. It was said to Ahmad: How is his Hadith? He said: He was not like Ibn Jurayj. And I heard Ahmad narrate from Al-Muthanna bin al-Sabbah.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: - Chapter on the People of Ta'if - [242] Al-Husayn informed us: Sulayman narrated to us: He said: I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal say: Ya'la bin Ata said to Shu'bah: 'Do not take from me from my father, for he has met so-and-so and so-and-so.' It was said to Ahmad: Did anyone else from his companions narrate from his father?—as a question. He said: No. I heard Ahmad say: Ya'la bin Ata is a sweet (Hulw), trustworthy Sheikh; he is a client of Abdullah bin Amr.

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: - Chapter on the People of Yemen - [243] He said: And I heard Ahmad say from Ibn Awn: He said: 'I have seen Ata and Tawus.' And the Hadith of this is that Ahmad narrated it to them from Uthman bin Umar from Ibn Awn. [244] I heard Ahmad say: I do not know who Mina is, from whom Abu Abd al-Razzaq narrates. [245] I heard Ahmad say: Abd al-Razzaq said: He said to me—meaning...

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: ...Ma'mar, 'Where is the house of Isma'il bin Sharus?', meaning to hear from him. I heard Ahmad say: Sufyan, meaning Al-Thawri, went to Yemen; I think he had merchandise with him, but I only think he wanted Ma'mar. I heard Ahmad say: Who attained from the chain of narration what Ma'mar attained? Ahmad said: He heard from Al-Zuhri in Al-Rusafah. He said: Where did he hear from Yahya bin Abi Kathir? He said: In Basra. [246] I said to Ahmad: Ibn Thawr? He said: Trustworthy. He is counted alongside Rabah bin Ubaydullah, [but] he is not like him. I heard Ahmad say: Ibn Thawr was a righteous man, [but] he did not have that alertness in Hadith. [247] I asked Ahmad about Abdur-Razzaq hearing from Ubaydullah. He said: Abdur-Razzaq said: I saw him in Mecca while Hisham bin Hassan was asking him. Ahmad said: By my life, he narrated...

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: ...from him, meaning Abdur-Razzaq, strange (Gharib) hadiths.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: - Chapter: The People of Egypt - [248] Al-Husayn informed us, Sulayman narrated to us, he said: I said to Ahmad: Musa bin Wardan? He said: I know nothing but good. [249] I said to Ahmad: Musa bin Ayyub Al-Ghafiqi? He said: A Sheikh, they narrated from him. [250] I heard Ahmad mention the hadith of Yahya bin Sa'id that the sister of Uqbah bin...

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: ...Amir made a vow. So he said: How good is the chain of Yahya from Ubaydullah bin Zahr. [251] I heard Ahmad say: It reached me that Ibn Al-Mubarak said: No one was described to me and then I saw him except that he was less than what was described to me, except Haywah bin Shurayh. I said to Ahmad: Haywah bin Shurayh? He said: Trustworthy. [252] I heard Ahmad say: Zuhrah bin Ma'bad is a trustworthy Sheikh; his grandfather has companionship (Suhbah).

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [253] I heard Ahmad say: Bakr bin Mudar and Sa'id bin Abi Ayyub are righteous, [and they are] two trustworthy men. I heard Ahmad say: They claimed that Al-Layth bin Sa'd said: 'No one remains from that army except Bakr bin Mudar', praising him. [254] I heard Ahmad say: Sa'id bin Abi Hilal, the ancient ones heard from him in Egypt. Then he went out, they claimed, to Medina, so he brought them a sack - or he said a load - of books. I wrote from the young ones and from everyone. Al-Layth bin Sa'd had heard from him, then he doubted in some of it, so he placed Khalid between himself and Sa'id. He said: Khalid bin Yazid is trustworthy; Abu Dawud said it. [255] He said: I heard Ahmad say: It reached me that Ibn Wahb came to Ibn Uyaynah and said: 'O Abu Muhammad, what the son of [my] sister presented to you the day before yesterday is my hearing (Sama').'...

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: ...I heard Ahmad say: I saw Ibn Wahb, and he was exaggerating, meaning in hearing, so I did not write anything from him, and his hadith [7a]. [256] I heard Ahmad say: Who in Egypt resembles Ibn Lahi'ah in the precision of Hadith, its abundance, and its mastery? I heard Ahmad say: The books of Ibn Lahi'ah were burnt, they claimed. Rishdin bin Sa'd had heard his books from him, so they used to take his books and bring nothing to him except that he read it.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [257] I heard Ahmad say: It reached me that Rishdin bin Sa'd came to Ibrahim ibn Abi Yahya, so Ibrahim said to him: 'Come so I can read to you.' He said: 'I do not want that; grant me authorization (Ijazah).' [258] I heard Ahmad mention Asad bin Musa, and he mentioned him with good. [259] I heard Ahmad being asked about Darraj Abu Al-Samh. He said: This one narrated many rejected (Munkar) hadiths. And in a hadith in whose chain is Darraj, the issue is with Darraj.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: - Chapter: The People of Ramla - [260] Al-Husayn informed us, Sulayman narrated to us, he said: I said to Ahmad: Raja' bin Abi Salamah? He said: Trustworthy, a Basran who ended up in Bayt al-Maqdis (Jerusalem). No one has narrated more from him than Damrah. [261] I said to Ahmad: Who is Ibn Shawdhab? He said: Bakh (an expression of praise). [262] I heard Ahmad being asked about Ibrahim bin Abi Ablah. He said: Trustworthy.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [263] I said to Ahmad: Damrah bin Rabi'ah? He said: Trustworthy, trustworthy. [264] I said to Ahmad: Al-Qasim bin Ghusn? He said: This one, I think, was in Sham, and he did not elevate it [to the Prophet].

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: - Chapter: The People of Ashkelon - [265] Al-Husayn informed us, Sulayman narrated to us, he said: I heard Ahmad say: Mus'ab bin Mahan narrates from Sufyan; he is trustworthy, he was in Ashkelon. [266] I heard Ahmad say: Abu Isam, meaning Rawwad bin Al-Jarrah, was a man of Sunnah. He was here, meaning in Baghdad, then he moved to Sham and met Al-Awza'i there. I heard him mention him another time, and he said: Truthful (Saduq) as far as I see. And I heard him mention him another time, and he said: Indeed, there are mistakes in his hadith.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [267] I heard Ahmad say: They claimed that Adam was firmly established with Shu'bah.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: - Chapter: The People of Caesarea - [268] Al-Husayn informed us, Sulayman narrated to us, he said: I heard Ahmad say - and he was mentioning those prioritized in Sufyan - so he said: After these, I do not prioritize Al-Ashja'i and his companions over Al-Firyabi. Meaning that he counts Al-Ashja'i and his companions after Al-Firyabi in the level that follows them.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: - Chapter: [The People of] Bayt al-Maqdis (Jerusalem) - [269] He said: I said to Ahmad: Shihab bin Kharash? He said: His origin was from Wasit, and he lived in Bayt al-Maqdis. I see no harm in him.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: - Chapter: The People of Jordan - [270] I asked Ahmad about Ubadah bin Nulay. He said: An old Levantine.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: - Chapter: The People of Damascus - [271] I heard Ahmad say: Al-Qasim Abu Abdur-Rahman is the son of Abdur-Rahman, he is a client of Abdur-Rahman bin Yazid bin Mu'awiyah. He said: Rejected (Munkar) hadiths are narrated from him. Ja'far bin Al-Zubayr was the first to narrate them in Basra, so [the people] abandoned his hadith. Then Bishr ibn Numayr came and narrated some of those hadiths, so the people of Basra abandoned [his hadith]. It comes to us...

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: ...later from Ubaydullah bin Zahr from Ali bin Yazid. [272] I heard Ahmad say: Rabi'ah bin Yazid, so Haywah heard from him. [273] I said to Ahmad: Yahya bin Al-Harith Al-Ramadi? He said: There is no harm [in him]. [274] I said to Ahmad: Burd bin Sinan? He said: There is no harm in him, but he held the view of Qadar (free will). [7b] They claimed that they sought out the Qadariyyah in Damascus, so he fled to Basra, and the Basrans heard from him.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [275] I heard Ahmad say: Dawud bin Amr is close (Muqarib) in Hadith; I see no harm in his hadith. He was Levantine and was in Wasit. I said: Was he a governor? He said: He was over some of Al-Sawad. [276] I said to Ahmad: Al-Hasan bin Yahya Al-Khushani? He said: There is no harm in his hadith. [277] I heard Ahmad say: Safwan bin Amr and Ibn Jabir, meaning Abdur-Rahman bin Yazid bin Jabir, are two trustworthy men. [278] I said to Ahmad: Yazid bin Yazid bin Jabir? He said: Bakh (praise). [279] And I heard Ahmad say: Ibn Jabir is good (Hasan) in Hadith. [280] I said to Ahmad: Abd al-Wahid bin Qays, whom Al-Awza'i narrated from? He said...

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: ...I do not know, I fear that his hadith is rejected (Munkar). [281] I said to Ahmad: Yazid bin Abi Maryam? He said: He was from the people of Damascus and was trustworthy. [282] I said to Ahmad: Yahya bin Yahya Al-Ghassani? He said: Trustworthy. [283] I said to Ahmad: Hisham bin Yahya Al-Ghassani? He said: I see no harm in him. I said: Hisham bin Yahya is his son, I mean the son of Yahya bin Yahya? He said: Yes.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [284] I heard Ahmad say: Sadaqah bin Khalid is trustworthy, and he is above Al-Walid bin Muslim, and he was a scribe. [285] I heard Ahmad say: May Allah have mercy on Abu Mushir, how firm he was! And he began to praise him.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: - Chapter: The People of Homs - [286] I said to Ahmad: Habib bin Ubayd? He said: Mu'awiyah and Thawr narrated from him; there is no harm in him. [287] I said to Ahmad: Bahir bin Sa'd? He said: Trustworthy. They claimed that Shu'bah said to Baqiyyah: 'Write for me the hadiths of Bahir.' Ahmad said: He used to admire the chain of narration. Ahmad said...

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: Which chains of narration from it? [288] I heard Ahmad, and Hariz [bin Uthman], Abu Bakr bin Abi Maryam, and Safwan were mentioned to him. He said: 'There is none among them like Hariz; no one is more established than him, and he did not hold the view of Qadar (predestination).' I heard Ahmad say: 'There is no one in the Levant more established than Hariz, unless it is Bahir.' It was said to Ahmad: 'What about Safwan?' He said: 'Hariz is trustworthy.' [289] It was said to Ahmad: 'What about Abd al-Rahman bin Yazid bin Jabir?' He said: 'Abd al-Rahman has no harm in him.' [290] I heard Ahmad say another time: 'Hariz is trustworthy, trustworthy.'

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [291] I heard Ahmad say: 'Ibn Ayyash, meaning Isma'il, did not narrate from a sheikh more trustworthy than Shurahbil bin Muslim.' [292] I heard Ahmad say: 'I asked in Homs about Abu Maryam, whom Mu'awiyah bin Salih narrates from. They said: He was the custodian of the mosque of Homs.' [293] I heard Ahmad say: 'Artah bin al-Mundhir is trustworthy.' [294] I heard Ahmad say: 'Utbah bin Damrah bin Habib is a trustworthy sheikh.' [295] I heard Ahmad being asked about Mu'adh bin Rifa'ah. He said: 'There was no harm in him.' [296] I said to Ahmad: 'Muhammad bin Muhajir?' He said: 'There is no harm in him, the brother of Amr bin...'

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: ...Muhajir.' [297] I heard Ahmad say: 'I saw the books of Shu'ayb bin Abi Hamzah, and they were corrected books; hardly anything is missing from them.' [298] Al-Husayn said: 'Abu Maryam, who narrates from Abu Hurayrah, is in my view connected.' [299] I heard Ahmad being asked about Shu'ayb bin Abi Hamzah. He said: 'Shu'ayb has no harm in him,' or he said 'Trustworthy, but whoever heard from him... Shu'ayb was a man who refrained regarding Hadith.' Ali bin Ayyash said: 'The book of Abu al-Zinad, he did not hear it from him; it was read to him.' [300a] I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal being asked about Isma'il bin Ayyash: 'Is he...

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: ...more established or Abu Fadalah?' [He said]: 'Abu Fadalah narrates from trustworthy narrators rejected (munkar) hadiths.' [300b] I said to Ahmad: 'Isma'il [bin Ayyash] or Baqiyyah?' He said: 'How close they are!' [300c] I asked Ahmad about Isma'il bin Ayyash. [He said: 'What he narrated] from their sheikhs.' I said: 'The [Levantine ones?' He said: 'Yes.] [8a] As for the hadith of others, he has rejected (munkar) narrations.'

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [301] I said to Ahmad: 'Safwan, meaning Ibn Amr?' He said: 'Salih (Righteous/Good).' [302] I heard Ahmad say: 'The most prolific narrator from Hariz is Isma'il bin Ayyash.' [303] Ibn Ayyash and Baqiyyah were mentioned to Ahmad. I said: 'Do you rely on anything from his hadith?' He said: 'If he narrates from his trustworthy sheikhs, I consider him [acceptable].' Baqiyyah. And I heard Ahmad say another time: 'Baqiyyah narrated from Ubaydullah, meaning Ibn Umar al-Umari, rejected (munkar) narrations.' [304] I said to Ahmad: 'Faraj bin Fadalah?' He said: 'If he narrates from the Levantines, there is no harm in him, but his hadith from Yahya bin Sa'id is confused (mudtarib).'

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [305] I heard Ahmad being asked: 'Shurayh bin Yazid?' He said: 'There is no harm in him.' [306a] I heard Ahmad being asked about Abu al-Yaman. He said: 'Salih (Righteous/Good), I have narrated much from him.' [306b] I said to Ahmad: 'Bishr bin Shu'ayb, meaning Ibn Abi Hamzah, is more beloved to you or Abu al-Yaman?' He said: 'Abu al-Yaman.' [306c] I asked Ahmad about Bishr another time. He said: 'I wrote from him about seventy hadiths. He was not a man of Hadith, but his father's books were with him.' I heard Ahmad being asked about Shu'ayb's books, 'Did Bishr hear them from his father?' He said: 'How would I know?'

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [307] I heard Ahmad when Yazid bin Abd Rabbih al-Jurjusi was mentioned in his presence. He said: 'How established he was! There was no one like him among them.'

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: - Chapter: The People of Ayla - [308] I heard Ahmad say: 'Waki' said: I saw Yunus al-Ayli and he had poor memory. Waki' heard three hadiths from him.' [309] I said to Ahmad: 'Is Uqayl, meaning Ibn Khalid, greater in your view than Yunus, meaning...

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: ...Ibn Yazid al-Ayli?' He said: 'I do not know. Uqayl and Yunus convey the wordings.' [310] 'Ma'mar used to memorize the wordings, he did not [just] convey.'

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: - Chapter: The People of Aleppo - [311] I heard Ahmad say: 'Abu Bishr al-Halabi narrated from Hayy; there is no harm in him.' [312] He said: I heard Ahmad being asked: 'Mubashir bin Isma'il al-Halabi?' He said: 'I...

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: ...saw him; there was no harm in him. I wrote five or six hadiths from him. We had come from the frontier when Harun, meaning the Commander of the Faithful, died, and I was sick.'

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: - Chapter: The People of Harran - [313] He said: I heard Ahmad being asked: 'Abd al-Karim al-Jazari?' He said: 'Trustworthy.' [314] I said to Ahmad: 'Musa bin A'yun?' He said: 'A righteous man, trustworthy.' [315] I heard Ahmad say: 'Khattab bin al-Qasim.' He said: 'There is no harm in him.' [316] I said to Ahmad: 'Attab bin Bashir? Abd al-Rahman refrained from his hadith.'

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: Al-Husayn said: 'That is because al-Khattabi narrated to him from him hadiths... He narrated from Abd al-Malik a rejected (munkar) hadith, and from so-and-so,' Ahmad named him. I said to Ahmad: 'How do you view him?' He said: 'Abu Ja'far narrates from him,' meaning al-Nufayli. I said: 'Yes.' He said: 'Abu Ja'far knows him better.' [317] I said to Ahmad: 'Miskin, meaning Ibn Bukayr?' He said: 'I saw him; there was no harm in him.' He said: And I heard Ahmad mention him another time, and he said: 'I saw in his hadith [errors], but there was no harm in him.'

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: I heard Ahmad say: 'Miskin heard from Shu'bah in Baghdad.' [318] [I said to Ah]mad: 'Is al-Nufayli more beloved to you regarding the hadith of Zuhayr or Ahmad ibn Yunus?' He said: 'Al-Nufayli is [a man of] intelligent hadith, and Ahmad bin Yunus is a righteous man.' [319] I mentioned to Ahmad Mu'ammal [bin al-Fadl], and he said: 'They claimed there is no harm in him.' [320] I heard Ahmad narrating from Abu Qatadah al-Harrani more than once. [8b]

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [321] I heard Ahmad being asked: 'Ali bin Thabit?' He said: 'He was the lightest of people. He would make a person laugh; he would narrate part of a hadith then cut it off and bring another. Al-Hasan bin Umarah was to him the most noble friend.'

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: - Chapter: The People of Mosul - [322] I heard Ahmad say: 'Umar bin Ayyub al-Mawsili had a [good] appearance.' And he began praising him.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: - Chapter: The People of Raqqa - [323] I said to Ahmad: 'Abdullah bin Bishr?' He said: 'This one, I do not see any harm in him.' I said: 'Does he narrate the likes of this, meaning the hadith of Al-A'mash from Abu Salih from Abu Hurayrah from the Prophet (peace be upon him): The cupper and the cupped have broken their fast?' He said: 'He is a sheikh who has...

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: ...narrated from Qatadah, and he has Mursal narrations.' [324] I heard Ahmad say: 'Zayd bin Abi Unaysah has no harm in him.' [325] I heard Ahmad say, when asked about Al-Walid bin Zarwan. He said: 'This one narrates...

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: ...from him, Abu al-Malih. I do not have that much knowledge of him.' [326] I said to Ahmad: 'Is Abu al-Malih more beloved to you or Ubaydullah bin Amr?' text: [338 a] I said to Ahmad: Is Abu Ma'shar dearer to you or Hammad? [338 b] I said to Ahmad: Is Mughirah dearer to you regarding Ibrahim or Hammad? He said: As for what Sufyan and Shu'bah narrated from Hammad, then Hammad is dearer to me, because in the Hadith of others from him there is confusion. [338 f] I heard Ahmad say: But Hammad bin Salamah has confusion regarding him - meaning regarding Hammad bin Abi Sulayman. [339] I said to Ahmad: Uqbah bin Huraith? He said: I know nothing but good. Ahmad said: They claimed that Yahya bin Zakariya bin Abi Za'idah said: 'If I wished to name everyone who informs my father from Al-Sha'bi, I would name them.' Al-Husayn said: He is Mutarrif bin Tarif al-Kufi; men narrate from him: Sufyan al-Thawri, Jarir, Asbat, and the people. [360] I heard Ahmad being asked about Firas.
