He said: 'Rawh, there was no harm in him; he was not accused of anything of this'—and lying had been mentioned. [533 b] And I heard Ahmad being asked: 'Is Rawh dearer to you or Abu Asim?' He said: 'Rawh used to bring out the book, while Abu Asim used to confuse hadith.'

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [533 c] It was said to him: 'Is Ibn Sawa dearer to you or Rawh regarding Sa'id?' He said: 'How close they are!' I said: 'Al-Khaffaf?' He said: 'Al-Khaffaf, except that he was older than both of them and more knowledgeable about Sa'id.' [534] I heard Ahmad say: 'Mu'tamar was a Hafiz (memorizer); rarely did we ask him about something but he had something on it'—meaning from the chapters. [535] I heard Ahmad say: 'There was a young man in Basra called Ayyub bin al-Mutawakkil; through him words were sought, and he would not take them except from the trustworthy.'

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [536] I heard Ahmad being asked about Shahr. He said: 'There is no harm in him.' I said: 'Did Yahya used to narrate from him?' He said: 'I do not know; I do not recall hearing anything from him about him.' Ahmad said: 'And Shu'bah narrated from Mu'awiyah bin Qurrah from Shahr.' Ahmad said: 'I tolerate him and narrate from him, whoever can be patient with those hadiths which he has.' [537] I heard Ahmad say: 'I saw Ibn Dawud but did not write from him; he used to love Opinion (Ra'y).' [538] Ahmad was asked: 'Who is the one who said: "I overlooked four hadiths of Qatadah?"' He said: 'Shu'bah. One of them is: Straighten your rows.'

book_title: Questions of Abu Dawud to Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the Disparagement and Praise of Narrators
text: [539] I heard Ahmad say: 'I do not know who Muhammad bin Ubaid is, who narrated from Qatadah from Ibn al-Musayyib regarding the one who has intercourse with his wife in Ramadan.' [540] He said: I heard Ahmad say: 'I used to think that Yahya heard from Ibn Jurayj from his books. But he said: "I copied it from a copy from which he had read multiple times." And [Ayu]b Bakr said: "We used to copy it from a book on parchments, and he would read fifty to us every day."' [541] I said to Ahmad: 'I heard Ali say: "The most prolific of them is Hisham"—I mean from Qatadah. And I said: A man said: "From Mu'adh with my father are ten thousand from Qatadah." He said: "All of this is what his son relates. As for Hisham, only about a thousand or nine hundred hadiths were extracted for him."'

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: hadith of Qad Mu'adh [?], hadiths that Sa'id does not raise [to the Prophet]. [542] I heard Ahmad say: Abu Awanah heard [was told] not to narrate it. So it was said to him: 'Did Shu'bah speak about it?' He said: 'Not Shu'bah, but they used to ask him frequently; everyone who came would say: Al-Hakam, Al-Hakam. He said: I will not narrate it.' [14b] [543] I heard Ahmad say: Ibn Awn said: Muhammad [Ibn Sirin] said to me: 'They hid you among whom they hid.' Ahmad said: This, I was informed about who it is, except for these. [544] I heard Ahmad being asked about Muslim bin Ibrahim, so he said: I did not see him nor did I write anything from him. [545] I heard Ahmad narrating from Abu Umar Al-Darir. [546] And I heard him narrating from Abu Hudhayfah.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [547] I heard Ahmad say: Muhammad bin Dinar, they claimed he did not memorize; he used to try to memorize for them. The hadith of Al-Massah (suckling) was mentioned to him, and he denied it. And I mentioned to him the hadith of Ibn Umar regarding the animal, and he said: 'Ibn Umar is not in it; it is from Ziyad bin Jubayr, Mawquf (halted at the Successor).'

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [548] I heard Ahmad say: Ibn Abi Adi narrated hadiths from Shu'bah which he raises [to the Prophet], which we reject from him. I heard Ahmad say: I fear that Shu'bah was not proficient in the wordings; he is disagreed upon regarding them. [549] I said to Ahmad: So Yahya, meaning Al-Qattan, in some of what he narrates of the hadith of others, inserts a man between them? He said: Yahya must have had an illusion (wahm). [550] I said to Ahmad: Mubarak bin Hassan, who narrated from him? He said: Al-Thawri.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: And Al-Musayyib bin Sharik narrated to us [from him]. Then Ahmad said to me: 'Do you think Abu Salamah, meaning Al-Mubarak, heard from him?' and he smiled. Al-Husayn said: Al-Musayyib bin Sharik is abandoned (Matruk).

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: - Chapter: The People of Al-Yamamah - [551] I said to Ahmad: Qays bin Talq? He said: I know no harm in him.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: I said to Ahmad: Then what about the hadith of touching the penis? What do you reject? He said: This is the majority view, meaning [those] who hold the view of [ablution from] touching the penis. [552] I said to Ahmad: Abdullah bin Badr, the companion of Qays bin Talq? He said: There is no harm in him, or a phrase similar to this. [553] I said to Ahmad: Jahdam, whom Al-Thawri narrated from, who is he? He said: They claimed [he is] Khurasani, and he was a righteous man, there was no harm in him, he lived in...

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: ...Al-Yamamah. [554] I heard Ahmad say: Damdam bin Jaws, I hope his hadith is firm. [555] I said to Ahmad: Abd Rabbih bin Bariq Al-Hanafi? He said: This one, I do not see that there was any harm in him. [556] I heard Ahmad say: Ayyub bin Jabir, there is no harm in him. He is the brother of Muhammad bin Jabir. It was said to Ahmad while I was listening: Who is more exemplary, he or his brother? He said: I do not know; his condition weakened towards the end of his life; he had lost his eyesight.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: - Chapter: The People of Khurasan - [557] Al-Husayn informed us, Sulayman narrated to us, saying: I said to Ahmad: Muqatil bin Hayyan? He said: I do not kn[ow]. [558] I heard Ahmad, it was said to him: Anbasah bin Sa'id, Hakkam narrated from him? He said: Anba[sah] is trustworthy.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [559] I heard Ahmad say: Ibrahim bin Tahman, he is authentic in Hadith, c[lose/approachable, except that he] used to hold the view of Irja'. [560] I said to Ahmad: Abu Sa'd Muhammad bin Maysa[r? He said: Al-Sinani?] is truthful, he said: But he was a Murji'. I said: Did you write [from him? He said: Yes.] [15a] [561] I heard Ahmad say: Whoever heard from Abu Hamzah Al-Sukkari—and he is Marwazi—before he lost his eyesight, then it is good. Ali bin Al-Hasan heard from him before he lost his eyesight, and Attab bin Ziyad heard from him after he lost his eyesight. [562] I heard Ahmad say: The early companions of Ibn Al-Mubarak are Sufyan...

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: ...meaning Ibn Abd al-Malik, and Ali bin Al-Hasan. And he began listing others besides them. He said: And Attab bin Ziyad is after them, and there is no harm in him. [563] I heard Ahmad, and it was said to him: Ali bin Mujahid Al-Razi? He said: We wrote from him; I see no harm in him. [564] He said: I heard Ahmad, it was said to him: Ali bin Al-Hasan bin Shaqiq? He said: There was no harm in him, except that they spoke about him regarding Irja', but he retracted from it.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: - Chapter: The Weak Narrators of the People of Medina - [565] Al-Husayn informed us, he said: Sulayman narrated to us, saying: I said to Ahmad: Why was the hadith of Yahya bin Ubaydullah abandoned? He said: His hadiths are rejected (Manakir), and his father is unknown. I heard Ahmad say: Yahya abandoned him later, meaning that Yahya bin Sa'id abandoned the hadith of Yahya bin Ubaydullah. [566] I heard Ahmad, and it was said to him: Husayn bin Ubaydullah, the companion of Ikrimah, is rejected in Hadith? He gestured with his head, meaning yes. It was said: Is he more beloved to you or Asim bin...

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: ...Ubaydullah? He said: How close they are, and Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Aqil. [567] I heard Ahmad say: Ibrahim bin Abi Yahya, Yahya used to speak about him with severe words. [568] And I heard Ahmad say: Abdullah bin Nafi', the client of Ibn Umar, he said: How close he is to Al-Umari Al-Saghir. [569] I said to Ahmad: Haram bin Uthman? He said: This is a Sheikh whose hadith the people have abandoned.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [570] I heard Ahmad say: I heard Ibrahim bin Sa'd—and Ibn Hanbal had mentioned Abdullah bin Ziyad bin Sam'an—he said: So he began swearing that he was a liar, meaning Ibrahim was the one swearing. Ahmad said: I have not seen anyone bolder against him than him on that day. I heard Ahmad say: They claimed that he used to narrate 'Mujahid narrated to us' while Ibn Ishaq was with him. So Ibn Ishaq began saying: 'By Allah, I have not seen the likes of this! I am older than him and I never saw Mujahid at all.' I heard Ahmad say: They claimed he brought out his book, and lo, in it was Ibn Jurayj from Amr bin Dinar from Jabir bin Zaid, so he said: 'Jabir bin Zaid narrated to us.'

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: He said: Ibrahim bin Sa'd said: I said to the nephew of Ibn Shihab: 'Did you ever see Ibn Sam'an at Al-Zuhri's?' He said: 'No.' I heard Ahmad say: Ibn Sam'an was known in Medina for worship, then he took to [Ha]dith. The book is completed with the praise of Allah, and may Allah bless Muhammad the Prophet and grant him peace. [15b]

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: Appendix of the Book. Introduction: I have previously indicated that an omission occurred in the original manuscript, covering side (b) of folio (11) and side (a) of folio (12). I explained this following text [432]. Then it appeared to me while tracking the texts of the book, especially in *Tarikh Baghdad*, that this omission took away a part of 'The People of Kufa', the 'Chapter of the People of Baghdad', and the beginnings of the 'Chapter of the People of Wasit'. So I decided, to complete the benefit and fill some gaps of the mentioned omission, to gather the texts that Al-Khatib extracted in *Tarikh Baghdad* via the route of the narrator of this book, Al-Husayn bin Idris Al-Ansari, from Abu Dawud, from Imam Ahmad. The result of this gathering was twenty-five texts starting with number [571] and ending with number [595]. The first eight of them relate to the people of Kufa, and the rest to the people of Baghdad. I have arranged them alphabetically. In order for the appendix to harmonize with the nature and methodology of the book, I placed the people of Kufa first and presented the texts in the manner they appeared in the book *Al-Su'alat*, removing the chains of narration that Al-Khatib cited so that the methodology of the appendix becomes like the methodology of the original, noting that Al-Khatib extracted all the texts of the mentioned appendix with a single chain from his Sheikh Al-Barqani to Al-Husayn bin Idris from Abu Dawud from Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: Appendix - Chapter: The People of Kufa - Al-Khatib Al-Baghdadi said in *Tarikh Baghdad*: Al-Barqani informed us, Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Hansawih Al-Harawi informed us, Al-Husayn bin Idris informed us, Sulayman bin Al-Ash'ath narrated to us, saying: [571] I said to Ahmad bin Hanbal: Isma'il bin Zakariyya? He said: He is Abu Ziyad, he was here; there was no harm in him.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [572] I said to Ahmad: Al-Ashja'i? He said: He used to write in the gathering, so because of that his hadith was authentic. [573] I heard Ahmad, and it was said to him: Ubaydah bin Humayd? He said: There is no harm in him. [574] I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal, and it was said to him: Abu Hafs Al-Abbar? He said: There was no harm in him. [575] I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal, and it was said to him: Qurran bin Tamam? He said: There is no harm in him. [576] I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal say: There was no one with a better memory than Marwan, meaning Ibn...

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: ...Mu'awiyah. He used to memorize all his hadith. And he said: I heard Ahmad say: Marwan bin Mu'awiyah is trustworthy. [577] I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal say: Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Umawi, there is no harm in him. He has strange narrations (Ghara'ib) from Al-A'mash. [578] I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal say: Waki' said: 'We used to count them from Sufyan, then we would write at home.' And Yahya bin Yaman used to tie a knot in a string, meaning he would count the hadith with it at Sufyan's, then go to the house, untie a knot, and write a hadith. But he has confusion (Takhlit). And he said once: 'And what confusion!', meaning Ibn Al-Yaman.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: Appendix - Chapter: The People of Baghdad - Al-Khatib Al-Baghdadi said in *Tarikh Baghdad*: Abu Bakr Al-Barqani informed us, Abu Hamid Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Hansawih Al-Harawi informed us, Al-Husayn bin Idris informed us, saying: [579] Abu Dawud Sulayman bin Al-Ash'ath said: Ibrahim Al-Harawi is weak. [580] I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal being asked about Abu Musa Al-Harawi. He said: The tall one? That is a friend of mine, and I have known him for a long time; he writes. And he praised him with good.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [581] And I heard Ahmad mention Bashar Al-Khaffaf, so he said: He was well-known, a man of Sunnah. [582] I saw Ahmad bin Hanbal writing from Abu Umar Al-Duri. [583] I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal being asked about Surayj bin Yunus. He said: There is no harm in him. [584] I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal, and it was said to him: Sa'd bin Ibrahim, the brother of Ya'qub? He said: There was no harm in him. And Ya'qub was more reciting of books and freer of head (more intelligent/memorizing) than him.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: He said: And I heard Ahmad say: Sa'd bin Ibrahim has something that Ya'qub did not hear: the book of Asim bin Muhammad Al-Umari. [585] I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal being asked: Is Amir Al-Ahwal more beloved to you or Asim Al-Ahwal? He said: Asim Al-Ahwal is a trustworthy Sheikh. [586] I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal being asked about Abdullah bin Awn Al-Khazzaz. He said: There is no harm in him; I have known him for a long time. And he began saying good things about him.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [587] I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal say: Abd al-Malik bin Abi Bashir is from the people of Al-Mada'in. Sufyan said: He was a truthful man. [588] I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal mention Uthman bin Umar from whom he narrated. He said: He was a righteous man. [589] I heard Ahmad, and it was said to him: Abu Qatan? He said: There was no harm in him. [590] I heard Ahmad, and it was said to him: Kamil bin Talhah? He said: I saw him in Basra, and he had a circle [of students], and he used to go to Abadan to narrate to them. His hadith is close (Muqarib) hadith.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [591] I heard Ahmad say: There is no one among them, meaning the people of Egypt, more authentic in hadith than Al-Layth bin Sa'd, and Amr bin Al-Harith approaches him. [592] I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal say: Abu Sa'id Al-Mu'addib is trustworthy. [593] I heard Ahmad mention a hadith from Abu Kamil, meaning Muzaffar bin Mudrik, from Ibrahim bin Sa'd. It was said to him: Ya'qub does not say 'liar' [or 'Ya'qub does not say he is a liar'? Context suggests validation]. He said: There is no one among them like him. I said to Abu Abdullah: Abu Kamil? He said: Yes.

book_title: Su'alat Abi Dawud li-l-Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal fi Jarh al-Ruwat wa Ta'dilihim
text: [594] I heard Ahmad say: Hawdhah bin Khalifah, how good his hadith was! [595] I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal, and it was said to him: Hilal bin Khabbab? He said: A trustworthy Sheikh. [This is the last of what I found in this appendix from the narration of the narrator of this book, Al-Husayn bin Idris, from Abu Dawud from Ahmad].
